result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman Joseph Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes: Sentence Withheld -  3 years probation; conditions of probation AODA treatment & follow-thru (05-15-15); No contact with Mike Woller, Sonja Sunderland, Joe Sajdera or their residence; absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use without a valid Rx; compliance with any recommended treatment; court costs totaling $518.00; 14CF195 restitution to the Sawyer Cty Sheriff Dept. in the amount of $775.00; The competency report in 13CM84 will be sent to DOC and they will be notified of the confidential nature of said report.  The report may be seen by the supervising agent or their superior but any other person must have Mr. Price's written consent.

miscConds.notes: $775.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$518.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
NO CONTACT with Mike Woller, Sonja Sunderland, Joe Sajdera or their place of residence.

The competency report in 13CM84 will be sent to DOC and they will be notified of the confidential nature of said report.  The report may be seen by the supervising agent or their superior but any other person must have Mr. Price's written consent.
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations (05-15-15)
Absolute Sobriety;   No drug use without a valid prescription.

Bruce Poquette appears for the state, DEF in court in custody with Atty Lance Nelsen, Courts calls Psychologist Rebecca Seifert by phone - sworn/testifies direct; cross  - court accepts report of doctor as an exhibit;  argument; parties cannot find in statutes where court must give a 2nd opinion in this matter.  Court finds DEF competent to proceed.    DEF counsel Motion to Withdraw court takes under advisement and will decide 4-8-16 1pm

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  all parties receieved report and Doctor found DEF competent to proceed, Atty Nelson is challenging the finding,  wants second evaluation and DEF wants new counsel,  court will not allow him to request new counsel when he says he is not competent.  Defendant Norman Price says in court and rejects finding of doctor and says he is not competent to proceed.  
 Court orders a second opinion for evaluation.

Defendant Norman J. Price in court with attorney Lance M. Nelsen.  Defendant Norman J. Price in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights; waives preliminary hearing; ack. receipt of Information; PSI waived; Joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; victim notification is completed; Defendant pleads NC to Ct. 1; court finds guilty and convicts on Ct. 1.  Court asks if there is any objection to releasing competency report to probation; Defendant/Attorney do not object to that.  The competency report in 13CM84 will be sent to DOC and they will be notified of the confidential nature of said report.  The report may be seen by the supervising agent or superior but any other person must have Mr. Price's written consent.   Sentence Withheld -  3 years probation; conditions of probation - AODA treatment & follow-thru (05-15-15); No contact with Mike Woller, Sonja Sunderland, Joe Sajdera or their residence; absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use without a valid Rx; compliance with any recommended treatment; court costs totaling $518.00; restitution to the Sawyer Cty Sheriff Dept. in the amount of $775.00; advised of appeal rights; plea questionnaire filed.  Cases DRI 15CM27 Ct. 1 & 2; 14CM141 Ct. 1 & 2; 13CM84; 14CF206;
